item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Random thought, a good way to go about the brute force method may be, if the EleventyNumber doesn't change at dayroll, to start a few moments before dayroll, so that the price resets part-way through.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: The message about the Black Market applies to the entire Party House, not just Over 11,000, and it's already noted on the Black Market page.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I was buying 11 entries at a time when I go this message:

You've contributed over 250K to your Village Today!
The Black Market won't help you out for fear of getting exposed!

This should probably go in the wiki

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
its incorrect.
it says winning number not current number. If the current number is between 1 and 10 then you could spend up to the maximum amount. If the winning number is between 1-10 then the current number must be 0 and a single buy in will cause you to win.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: No, that bit is correct. That assumption applies to the maximum required. If the number isn't between 1 and 10, it will take fewer attempts than the maximum.

item.title: wrong assumption
item.content:encoded:
on the "maximum required to win", it says you need to buy 1000 attempts.
however, the "assumptions" list includes this incorrect tidbit "The winning number that day is between 1-10, which has a probability of 1/1,000 (slightly less than 0.091%)."
This is not an assumption of that strategy. I would edit it myself but i haven't been a member for 30 days yet.
